results.deck: A skateboarding game based off of the immensely popular animated TV series.
results.name: The Simpsons Skateboarding

results.deck: SOCOM II is the second game in Zipper's popular SOCOM franchise. It was one of the most popular online-multiplayer games for PS2 due to its solid gameplay and online mechanics.
results.name: SOCOM II: U.S. Navy SEALs

results.deck: Race in Super PickUps!
results.name: Super PickUps

results.deck: Gaelic Games: Football was the first Gaelic Football game released. It was released in November 2005.
results.name: Gaelic Games: Football

results.deck: The third game in the Metal Slug series, first released to arcades in 2000 and later ported to many home consoles, PCs, and mobile devices.
results.name: Metal Slug 3

results.deck: Way of the Samurai 2 is an open-ended Samurai game, where your choices dictate the storyline.
results.name: Way of the Samurai 2

results.deck: The Darkest Faerie has returned to take over Meridell and Brightvale in this RPG/Platformer Neopets Game
results.name: Neopets: The Darkest Faerie

results.deck: kill.switch is a third-person shooter from Namco, released in 2003, popularly known for pioneering the modern third-person cover system.
results.name: kill.switch

results.deck: Cocoto makes his first appearance in a platform game.
results.name: Cocoto Platform Jumper

results.deck: Dynasty Warriors 3 builds on the foundation of Dynasty Warriors 2's hack-n-slash mechanics, with the player's chosen officer squaring off against thousands of foes.
results.name: Dynasty Warriors 3

results.deck: The fifth game in the Breath of Fire series. It is a... major departure from the series' standard turn-based JRPG roots, to say the least.
results.name: Breath of Fire: Dragon Quarter

results.deck: Tak 2: The Staff of Dreams is the 2nd game in the popular Tak franchise.
results.name: Tak 2: The Staff of Dreams

results.deck: Fugitive Hunter: War on Terror is a first-person shooter, where players must find and apprehend America's ten most wanted fugitives, including Osama bin Laden.
results.name: Fugitive Hunter: War on Terror

results.deck: MotoGP 2 brings the excitement and energy of the fans and media into the game world like never before. MotoGP 2 is the second game in the critically acclaimed MotoGP:Ultimate Racing Technology series.
results.name: MotoGP 2

results.deck: A trip back in time with some of the greatest wrestlers in history.
results.name: Legends of Wrestling

results.deck: Do whatever you can to win back all of your cars. Explore Los Angeles seamlessly in L.A. Rush. The title was shortened to simply "Rush" on the PSP.
results.name: L. A. Rush

results.deck: Fallout: Brotherhood of Steel is a top-down hack and slash game set in the post-apocalyptic Fallout universe using a modified version of Snowblind's Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance engine. Players explore dungeons, complete quests, kill monsters and gather loot in single player or two player cooperative gameplay.
results.name: Fallout: Brotherhood of Steel

results.deck: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.13: OutRun is a remake of the arcade classic as part of the Sega Ages series. This version was included in the Sega Classics Collection when released in America and Europe.
results.name: SEGA AGES 2500 Vol.13: OutRun

results.deck: An RPG with eight characters whose stories are played sequentially (instead of simultaneously and together like other RPGs) and where one character's play will alter subsequent story and play.
results.name: Romancing SaGa

results.deck: In this party game, players traverse a board game representation of five different realms, all which are locations from the film. Players then take turns battling it out in different mini games all in the pursuit of "Precious Drops", the winning factor of the game.
results.name: Shrek Super Party

results.deck: With engaging gameplay and its deep Master League mode, Pro Evolution Soccer set the foundations for Konami Computer Entertainment Tokyo's successful soccer simulation franchise
results.name: Pro Evolution Soccer

results.deck: Chulip tells the story of a young boy, and his quest to kiss a certain charming young girl under an old ancient tree.
results.name: Chulip

results.deck: ESPN NBA 2K5 is the sixth installment of the NBA 2K series of realistic basketball games, updating the roster to the 2004/2005 NBA season while re-inventing the franchise mode (now known as "The Association").
results.name: ESPN NBA 2K5

results.deck: The seventh installment of the main Dance Dance Revolution series.
results.name: DDRMAX Dance Dance Revolution

results.deck: Amplitude is a music/rhythm game and is the sequel to 2001's Frequency. Like its predecessor, players play songs by hitting notes on multiple tracks representing each instrument found in the song.
results.name: Amplitude

results.deck: View and navigate photos of the Japanese idol Megumi. Released in 2003.
results.name: Motion Gravure Series: Megumi

results.deck: Using the Dreamcast microphone, Seaman allows players to raise a witty fish-like creature with some guidance from Leonard Nimoy.
results.name: Seaman

results.deck: NASCAR licensed racing with challenges like Beat the Heat and Pro Mode, in addition to the usual Championship season.
results.name: NASCAR Heat 2002

results.deck: Trigger Heart Exelica is a Japanese vertical scrolling shoot 'em up by Warashi. Originally for Arcades but ported to DC & XBLA and now recently announced for PS2.
results.name: Trigger Heart Exelica

results.deck: The Getaway is a sandbox crime game set in London.
results.name: The Getaway

results.deck: A collection of the first six games of the Mega Man X series, as well as Megaman: Battle and Chase, which had never previously been released in North America.
results.name: Mega Man X Collection

results.deck: Join Tony Hawk and his pro skater team as they try to beat Bam Margera's group of misfits in the over-the-top World Destruction Tour.
results.name: Tony Hawk's Underground 2

results.deck: A sequel to Shiny's MDK. MDK 2 is developed by Bioware and notably when compared to the first game, you get to play as all three main characters this time. Published by Interplay and released in 2000. An HD remake is currently available on Steam.
results.name: MDK 2

results.deck: The Incredibles: Rise of the Underminer is a follow-up to THQ's action game starring Disney and Pixar's animated family of superheroes.
results.name: The Incredibles: Rise of the Underminer

results.deck: The third game in the Bloody Roar series and the first game in the series for the PS2.
results.name: Bloody Roar 3
Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Jungle Storm

results.deck: In the sixth entry in the popular horror franchise, Leon S. Kennedy is sent to investigate when the President's daughter is kidnapped by terrorists with an unclear agenda. With the game receiving a complete overhauling from previous titles, and a story unrelated to the T-virus or the Umbrella Corporation, Resident Evil 4 is one of the most lauded action games ever made.
results.name: Resident Evil 4

results.deck: The fourth mainline game in the Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six series.
results.name: Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six: Lockdown

results.deck: Ace Combat 4 is an arcade style combat flight game set in a fictional Earth-like universe in which a series of asteroid impacts have destabilized world politics and led to war between the nation of Erusea and the Independent State Allied Forces, or ISAF.
results.name: Ace Combat 04: Shattered Skies

results.deck: Cute but challenging, I-Ninja is a third-person adventure that mixes in all kinds of gameplay.
results.name: I-Ninja

results.deck: 3rd Strike is the final version of Capcom's big fizzle, Street Fighter III, including several new characters and a wealth of gameplay revisions over its predecessor, 2nd Impact.
results.name: Street Fighter III: 3rd Strike

results.deck: BloodRayne 2 is the 2004 multi-platform sequel to the original BloodRayne. Like its 2002 predecessor, BloodRayne 2 is a third person action adventure developed by Terminal Reality.
results.name: BloodRayne 2

results.deck: SingStar was the PlayStation 2 game that kicked off a crazy of karaoke sequels for Sony's European division.
results.name: SingStar

results.deck: Eternal Quest is a roguelike game where you navigate a warrior through a series of danger-filled floors.
results.name: Eternal Quest

results.deck: Run, jump and spin through levels as Sonic and Tails, in order to thwart the plans of the nefarious Dr. Robotnik and free the kidnapped animals! Released by Sega in 1992, Sonic the Hedgehog 2 is often considered one of the greatest platformers of all time.
results.name: Sonic the Hedgehog 2

results.deck: The third installation of Midway Arcade Tresures focuses on the company's driving games.
results.name: Midway Arcade Treasures 3

results.deck: Spider-Man 2 is a sandbox game based on the movie of the same name.
results.name: Spider-Man 2

results.deck: Follow Haseo the adept rogue in his endeavour to save his friend Shino from a coma and learn the secrets behind "The World."
results.name: .hack//G.U. Vol. 1: Rebirth

results.deck: WWF SmackDown! makes the jump to the PlayStation 2 with WWF SmackDown! Just Bring It.
results.name: WWF SmackDown! Just Bring It

results.deck: Using a small blob of mercury, you must roll, squeeze, and transform your way through a series of progressively harder, obstacle-filled levels.
results.name: Mercury Meltdown

results.deck: StarBlade was an arcade shoot 'em up released in 1991 by Namco. It is a rail shooter featuring flat-shaded polygonal graphics.
results.name: StarBlade

results.deck: Scooby-Doo must brave his fears and help collect clues for Velma, Scooby can also change customs to give him more abilities, such as kung-fu.
results.name: Scooby-Doo! Unmasked

results.deck: Challenge as your favourite national squad for the World Cup.
results.name: FIFA World Cup: Germany 2006

results.deck: Play as Lyra in attempt to save her father in this game based on the novel adapted movie of the same name.
results.name: The Golden Compass

results.deck: A solid step forward for the NHL Franchise, NHL 2004 improved the game's graphics and puck physics.  The Addition of Dynasty mode, selecting when to fight, new Stanley Cup celebrations, made this game one of the most innovative in the series.
results.name: NHL 2004

results.deck: The Urbz is a console-oriented spin-off of the Sims series. Unlike other Sims titles it focuses less on building and furnishing homes and more on social interactions.
results.name: The Urbz: Sims in the City

results.deck: Released early in the life of the PlayStation 2, Dark Cloud is an RPG with traditional hack & slash gameplay, mixed with the Georama world construction system, and weapon development mechanics.
results.name: Dark Cloud

results.deck: Strategy RPG in the Summon Night series.
results.name: Summon Night 4

results.deck: A game based on the Bratz series of dolls.
results.name: Bratz: Rock Angelz

results.deck: Digital Devil Saga 2 sees the members of the embattled Embryon tribe experience true Nirvana in this direct sequel that adds new characters, overhauls the mantra grid, and closes the storyline in truly universal fashion.
results.name: Shin Megami Tensei: Digital Devil Saga 2

results.deck: Snowboard Supercross (SSX) is the ground-breaking PS2 launch title from EA Canada. It helped pave the way for many similar "extreme" sports games.
results.name: SSX

results.deck: Atelier Iris 2: Tha Azoth of Destiny is a console role-playing game developed by GUST for the Playstation 2. It was released in North America by NIS America and in Europe by KOEI. The game is a prequel to Atelier Iris: Eternal Mana.
results.name: Atelier Iris 2: The Azoth of Destiny

results.deck: Finding the eccentric Hans Voralberg was just the beginning. Having left her old life behind, Kate Walker follows the Hans on an incredible journey full of peril and wonder in this sequel to Syberia acclaimed game by Benoît Sokal.
results.name: Syberia II

results.deck: A game released to coincide with the move of the same name.
results.name: Ice Age 2: The Meltdown

results.deck: A rhythm action game for the PS2. You can play a platypus on it.
results.name: Technic Beat

results.deck: PlayStation 2 exclusive follow-up to the 1999 game based on the comic books of the same name.
results.name: Shadow Man: 2econd Coming

results.deck: Utilizing similar gameplay mechanics as previous Metal Slug games, Metal Slug 4 stays true to the series, but also manages to keep things fresh with new bosses, weapons, vehicles, and a combo system.
results.name: Metal Slug 4

results.deck: Aero Fighters is a vertical-scrolling shooter. The player gets to pick which nation they want to fight as and then proceeds to fight an onslaught of enemies and bosses.
results.name: Aero Fighters

results.deck: .hack//OUTBREAK is a role-playing game that simulates being an MMORPG. It is the third game in the .hack series.
results.name: .hack//OUTBREAK - Part 3

results.deck: A sequel to Dead or Alive, Dead or Alive 2 includes new characters, new environments and a whole new great experience for the fighting series
results.name: Dead or Alive 2

results.deck: Soul Reaver 2 was the 3rd installment in the Legacy of Kain franchise. In pursuit of Kain, Raziel travels back in time to different eras in Nosgoth's past. Through history, Raziel begins to piece together his intended destiny, or his inevitable fate.
results.name: Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver 2

results.deck: Freestyle MetalX is a Free Roaming, Trick Based MotoCross Game.
results.name: Freestyle MetalX

results.deck: A real time strategy game set in the Army Men universe. Players collect plastic and electricity to create tiny soldiers and vehicles in the fight against the tan army.
results.name: Army Men RTS

results.deck: The Mark of Kri is a mash up of American artwork styles like Disney and Don Bluth, a combination of Polynesian, Asian, and European cultures, and the kind of over the top, brutal violence of the Conan series, all swirled up into one unique, if linear, game.
results.name: The Mark of Kri

results.deck: Asterix and Obelix: Kick Buttix (also known as Asterix and Obelix: XXL in Europe) is a Beat-Ém-Up and platforming title for PS2, PC and Gamecube, released November 21, 2003 in France. It was published by Atari and developed by Etranges Libellules
results.name: Asterix and Obelix: Kick Buttix

results.deck: Seven Samurai 20XX follows the story of Natoe, a young hunter trained in the art of Nitou-Ryu as he battles against humans and humanoids alike.
results.name: Seven Samurai 20XX

results.deck: Pro Evolution Soccer 5 is the fifth instalment in the popular sports games series. The game was the first in the series to feature online network play.
results.name: Pro Evolution Soccer 5

results.deck: The fourth Pro Skater game changes up the single-player structure, while making some tweaks and additions to the established skating gameplay.
results.name: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 4

results.deck: Take control of Wolverine as he uncovers his own dark past and tries to find the cure to the deadly Shiva virus.
results.name: X2: Wolverine's Revenge

results.deck: Onimusha: Dawn of Dreams slashes its way back onto the PlayStation 2, in this 2 disc epic adventure.
results.name: Onimusha: Dawn of Dreams
